description.raw:
I’m working on the scoring plugin for the “Find symbols and dock” task and here’s a first pull request with the following changes:

* Initial world for this task.
* Change in the way the light buoy was working. Before, we were using a combination of three visual plugins \(\`gazebo\_ros\_color\`\) in each light buoy visual, and one model plugin in the light buoy model. This last plugin was sending the color pattern via ROS to the visual plugins. Also, it wasn't possible to set a specific pattern from an SDF parameter. In the new approach we only need one plugin and the pattern is not communicated over ROS unless you call the `/vrx/light_buoy/shuffle` service.
description.html:
I’m working on the scoring plugin for the “Find symbols and dock” task and here’s a first pull request with the following changes:

  • Initial world for this task.
  • Change in the way the light buoy was working. Before, we were using a combination of three visual plugins (`gazebo_ros_color`) in each light buoy visual, and one model plugin in the light buoy model. This last plugin was sending the color pattern via ROS to the visual plugins. Also, it wasn't possible to set a specific pattern from an SDF parameter. In the new approach we only need one plugin and the pattern is not communicated over ROS unless you call the /vrx/light_buoy/shuffle service.

title: Find symbols and dock - Part 1

summary.raw:
I’m working on the scoring plugin for the “Find symbols and dock” task and here’s a first pull request with the following changes:

* Initial world for this task.
* Change in the way the light buoy was working. Before, we were using a combination of three visual plugins \(\`gazebo\_ros\_color\`\) in each light buoy visual, and one model plugin in the light buoy model. This last plugin was sending the color pattern via ROS to the visual plugins. Also, it wasn't possible to set a specific pattern from an SDF parameter. In the new approach we only need one plugin and the pattern is not communicated over ROS unless you call the `/vrx/light_buoy/shuffle` service.
summary.html:
I’m working on the scoring plugin for the “Find symbols and dock” task and here’s a first pull request with the following changes:

  • Initial world for this task.
  • Change in the way the light buoy was working. Before, we were using a combination of three visual plugins (`gazebo_ros_color`) in each light buoy visual, and one model plugin in the light buoy model. This last plugin was sending the color pattern via ROS to the visual plugins. Also, it wasn't possible to set a specific pattern from an SDF parameter. In the new approach we only need one plugin and the pattern is not communicated over ROS unless you call the /vrx/light_buoy/shuffle service.
